content.question: The slope field for a certain differential equation is shown above. Which of the following could be a solution to the differential equation with initial condition <math alttext="y of 0, equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="y equals, the natural log of, the absolute value of, 1 minus x, end absolute value" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>|</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, e raised to the negative x squared power, minus 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, the fraction with numerator x, and denominator 1 minus x, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, the fraction with numerator x squared, and denominator 1 minus x squared, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="y equals, the fraction with numerator x, and denominator 1 minus x, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Identify a re-expression of mathematical information presented in a given representation
